intro: Curcumorpha longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered turmeric. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, characterized by its aromatic rhizomes and showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow-orange flowers with prominent stamens. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The botanical structure of Curcumorpha longiflora supports its role in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
